Subjective: Irritated left eye since Tuesday morning. Sensation of foreign body (dust/hair). Progressively redder and thicker. Right eye became red yesterday. Eyes feel 'stuck' in the morning. Pain only on squeezing eyes shut hard. No vision changes, photophobia, fever, or flu-like symptoms. No known trauma. No new cosmetics or creams. No contact lenses. Social: Lives with daughter; boyfriend currently away on holiday for 10 days. Concern: Worried it could be something other than a simple infection, become worse, or be contagious to her daughter. Request: Confirmation of diagnosis and guidance on needing eye drops or antibiotics.
Objective: Vitals: Not recorded. Eyes: Bilateral conjunctival injection noted, Left > Right. No foreign body visible on upper or lower conjunctiva. Eyelashes normal. Pupils equal, round, and reactive to light. No discharge noted during exam.
Plan: 1. Reassurance: Explained as likely viral inflammation, typically self-resolving within 2 weeks. 2. Advice: Avoid rubbing eyes. May clean with lukewarm tap water and cotton pad if stuck in the morning. 3. Medication: Over-the-counter artificial tears can be used as needed for soothing/irritation. Antibiotics not indicated at this time. 4. Safety Netting: Return immediately for increased pain, increased pus/discharge, eye becoming more stuck shut, or any vision changes. 5. Follow-up: Re-evaluate in 2 weeks if symptoms have not resolved.
